decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by using counterspells, removal, and powerful artifacts like Mindslaver and Tinker to manipulate the opponent's board state. The deck also utilizes powerful mana acceleration with Moxen and other fast mana sources to cast game-winning spells like Ancestral Recall and Tolarian Academy. With access to tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, the deck can search for key combo pieces like Time Walk and Yawgmoth's Will to maintain its advantage and lock the opponent out of the game.

The main concept of this Combo - Dredge deck is to utilize cards like Urza's Bauble, Mishra's Bauble, and Serum Powder to quickly fill up the graveyard with key cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Nether Shadow. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and City of Brass, the player can consistently discard cards and trigger dredge abilities, allowing them to quickly reanimate creatures like Ichorid and Ashen Ghoul. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, recursive threats while disrupting their strategy with cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void, Null Rod, and Wasteland, while also utilizing powerful artifacts and creatures like Mishra's Workshop, Juggernaut, and Razormane Masticore to apply pressure. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Crucible of Worlds and Goblin Welder, while also having access to powerful one-of spells like Ancestral Recall, Tinker, and Time Walk to swing the game in its favor. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive threats and disruptive elements.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Goblin creatures, utilizing mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus and Chrome Mox to deploy threats early and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Goblin Sharpshooter and Goblin King. The deck aims to maintain board presence with Goblin Matron and Goblin Ringleader to search for crucial Goblin cards while using cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the main goal is to apply intense pressure and win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a horde of Goblins.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids as a control mechanism to manipulate the battlefield to your advantage. By utilizing key cards like Chalice of the Void, Mana Drain, and Force of Will, you can disrupt your opponent's strategy while setting up your own win condition with Oath of Druids. The deck also includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Library of Alexandria, and iconic Mox artifacts to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. With a mix of counterspells, disruptive elements, and powerful threats like Akroma and Razia, this deck aims to control the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of elves. The key concept revolves around utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Fyndhorn Elves and Llanowar Elves to cast powerful threats like Wirewood Herald and Wirewood Hivemaster. The deck also leverages powerful mana producers like Priest of Titania and Gaea's Cradle to generate even more mana and maintain a constant stream of threats. Other cards like Skullclamp and Concordant Crossroads provide additional card draw and haste, respectively, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using the interaction between Auriok Salvagers and an artifact called Black Lotus. By using the Salvagers' ability to return an artifact from the graveyard to your hand at the cost of two life, you can continuously recur the Black Lotus to generate an infinite amount of mana. This mana can then be used to cast spells like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and other powerful cards to gain a significant advantage over your opponent. The deck also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Duress to disrupt your opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and mana base while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It aims to control the game by utilizing disruption spells like Duress and Hymn to Tourach, along with efficient creatures like Dark Confidant and Hypnotic Specter. The deck also includes disruptive artifacts like Null Rod to further hinder the opponent's game plan. With the ability to quickly disrupt and pressure the opponent, this deck aims to gain control of the game and win by steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent while quickly building up a board presence with efficient creatures like Nimble Mongoose and Werebear. The deck is focused on tempo plays, utilizing cards such as Stifle, Daze, and Null Rod to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing control with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk provide additional card advantage and tempo advantage, allowing the deck to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Auriok Salvagers and Black Lotus to generate infinite mana. This allows the player to utilize powerful control elements such as Mana Drain, Force of Will, and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing into key pieces with Brainstorm and Thirst for Knowledge. The deck also includes efficient removal and disruption options like Disenchant and Pithing Needle to handle threats and protect the combo. Overall, the strategy centers around a consistent and resilient combo engine backed up by versatile control and disruption elements.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells and disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Duress, while also utilizing Oath of Druids to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Akroma, Angel of Wrath. The deck also includes powerful one-off cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and the Moxen to generate mana advantage. The deck aims to control the game through disruption and card advantage, while also having a strong win condition in the form of powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful mana acceleration and tutors to quickly assemble a lethal combo that can generate massive storm count and win the game in a single turn. It includes a variety of fast mana artifacts, card draw spells, and disruption to protect the combo, ultimately aiming to cast Tendrils of Agony or generate a large Storm count to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Moxen, and Yawgmoth's Will provides additional consistency and explosiveness to the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells while disrupting their mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Kataki, War's Wage. The deck aims to control the board early on with cards like Jötun Grunt and Kami of Ancient Law while dealing direct damage with Lightning Helix and Lightning Bolt. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Umezawa's Jitte and Cursed Scroll provide additional utility and win conditions in combination with cards like Isamaru, Hound of Konda and Genju of the Spires. The deck also includes some powerful vintage restricted cards like Sol Ring, Black Lotus, and Balance to swing the game in its favor.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while aggressively attacking with efficient creatures like Isamaru, Hound of Konda and Savannah Lions. The deck also utilizes powerful disruptive spells like Force of Will and Meddling Mage to control the game. It aims to maintain board presence while denying the opponent resources through cards like Null Rod and Wasteland. The addition of cards like Jötun Grunt and Kataki, War's Wage further disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing board control through disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Jötun Grunt, backed up by counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak to protect its threats. Standstill slows down the opponent while the deck ramps up with powerful mana acceleration like Black Lotus and Moxen. Wasteland and Strip Mine disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Aether Vial allows for flash creatures to be played at instant speed. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the game until victory.
